image.altText: Two men hugging

props.synopsis: Israel is refusing to take responsibility for the drone strike that killed Hamas kingpin Saleh al-Arouri, but his death does follow a vow from Israeli officials to hunt down those involved in the October 7 attack.

title.children: A Hamas leader thought he was safe. His death may suggest a global assassination campaign is underway

image.altText: Destroyed cars after an explosion in Iran.

props.synopsis: Two explosions in Iran have killed almost 100 people, and injured more than 200 others, at a ceremony honouring a top military commander who was killed by a US drone strike in 2020, Iranian officials say.

title.children: Blasts near Iranian general's grave kill almost 100, injure hundreds more: local officials

image.altText: A woman smiles, standing in front of a large female choir

props.synopsis: The Brindabella Chorus were crowned champions at an international barbershop singing contest in Louisville, Kentucky.

title.children: From humble beginnings in Canberra, this all-female choir is now among the best in the world

image.altText: Nic Welch holds a life jacket

props.synopsis: Queensland tourism operators are feeling forgotten and ignored by governments after devastating storms destroyed what should be their most lucrative time of year.

title.children: This small Queensland business has lost thousands in less than a fortnight and its next busiest period is 'quite some time away'

image.altText: A prince and princess wave to the crowd

props.synopsis: Mary Donaldson sought out a deportment course in Sydney's Darlinghurst soon after meeting Denmark's Crown Prince Frederik in Sydney, to "transform her life".

title.children: How Princess Mary trained at a Sydney deportment school to become the future queen of Denmark

image.altText: White plane engulfed in flames at night on tarmac at Haneda airport in Tokyo, Japan

props.synopsis: This is what we know about what led to the crash and how all 379 people on the commercial aircraft survived.

title.children: Leaving bags behind a major factor in safe evacuation of burning Japan Airlines plane, experts say

image.altText: Waiter carrying breakfast orders with a plate in each hand

props.synopsis: A Geelong restaurant has upped its prices by 10 per cent for the "peak season". While some patrons are outraged, industry experts say it may be a sign of the increasing cost of running a hospitality venue.

title.children: Geelong restaurant adds 'peak season' charge to January menu after renting house to accommodate staff

image.altText: A selfie taken by a woman with black hair and earrings next to an older man in glasses and both of them are smiling.

props.synopsis: A family trip to Malaysia becomes a crisis when Kelly Eng and her ageing parents are thrown into physical combat against men in balaclavas carrying machetes.

title.children: Kelly thought her father was getting old. Then she saw him fight off machete-wielding thieves

image.altText: Two children walk past rubble at a refugee camp in central Gaza strip

props.synopsis: The question for Israel's government is how its campaign against Hamas — and its horrifying civilian toll — will prevent a new generation of people taking up arms? The answer, according to anti-terror experts, is not via military means, writes Eric Tlozek.

title.children: The key question Israel must ask about its Gaza strategy

image.altText: A man wearing a bright yellow shirt celebrates.

props.synopsis: With the Australian Open on the horizon, Alex De Minaur defeats Novak Djokovic in straight sets, as the host nation advances to the United Cup semifinals in Perth.

title.children: De Minaur produces biggest win of fledgling career, downing world number one Djokovic

image.altText: Man holds up tennis racket cheering in red shirt

props.synopsis: Former Australian tennis player John Alexander says rules governing how medical timeouts are used in tennis need to be changed after Novak Djokovic's win against Jiri Lehecka following a wrist injury.

title.children: Former Australian great says medical timeout rules need to be changed because of Djokovic

image.altText: An aerial shot shows building damaged and trees knocked over by storms

props.synopsis: More than 6,000 homes and businesses are still without power more than a week after powerful Christmas holiday storms ripped through Queensland's south-east.

title.children: 'No running water, no power, no internet': Extra storm recovery help on the way for exhausted south-east Queenslanders

image.altText: A close-up of a baby's hand holding onto an adult's fingers.

props.synopsis: A 62-year-old woman is given permission to have sperm extracted from her dead husband to conceive a baby, after the couple lost their two adult children in separate accidents.

title.children: Australian woman, 62, whose husband died suddenly wins legal permission to extract his sperm

image.altText: A pastel pink front door to a white multi-storey weatherboard house. 'Maison de rose' sign on the right

props.synopsis: It's easy to watch home DIY shows and marvel at — and maybe judge — the bold choices people make. But stamping your personality on your home doesn't need to involve big renovations.

title.children: Renovating these holidays? Here are some low-risk, high-reward ideas to put a stamp on your home

image.altText: A crowd gathers on a river bank.

props.synopsis: Three women and four men were hospitalised after contracting the non-contagious disease from potentially contaminated cooling towers.

title.children: Legionnaires' disease outbreak linked to Sydney CBD puts thousands on health alert

image.altText: Two glasses of bubbly wine on a bench with water and islands in the background

props.synopsis: Travel insurance can give you the protection you need if your holiday doesn't go as planned. But don't count on it if something happens to you and alcohol is a factor.

title.children: How drinking on holiday could impact your travel insurance claim

image.altText: A Tasmania Police officer stands in front of a patrol car in Hobart's CBD.

props.synopsis: Tasmania Police has confirmed the officer is the subject of an internal professional standards investigation in relation to the alleged incident.

title.children: Senior female police officer stood down after harassment allegations at end-of-year social function

image.altText: More revelations in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation

props.synopsis: A US court is expected to start releasing the names of dozens of people with ties to deceased financier Jeffrey Epstein on Wednesday US time, a move that could reveal new details about his sex trafficking.

title.children: Names of Jeffrey Epstein's associates set to be released

image.altText: A woman wearing a wedding ring has her hand on a man's chest as he wraps his arms around her.

props.synopsis: Lauren Fried shares a video montage marking eight years since their wedding as she documents the family's missed milestones since her husband's death in May.

title.children: 'Our dream of growing old together': Jock Zonfrillo's wife shares emotional posts for missed anniversary

image.altText: Pat Cummins has his hands on his hips as he looks down as Mitchell Starc smiles

props.synopsis: In the first Test of a new year, Australia lets an opportunity to dominate Pakistan in Sydney slip away thanks to a familiar failing it may have wished to have had banished to 2023.

title.children: The only weakness in Australia's bowling attack is again exposed by Pakistan at the SCG

image.altText: Michaela Windsor: OzHarvest Queensland State Manger, Michaela Windsor

props.synopsis: Australia's leading food rescue organisation says it's facing unprecedented demand in Queensland due to cost of living pressures.

title.children: As the cost-of-living crisis bites, charities are seeing a 'new cohort coming through'

image.altText: a 7-storey building is seen collapsed onto its side

props.synopsis: Authorities have confirmed 64 deaths, with thousands of buildings, vehicles and boats damaged. It's possible that more strong shocks could hit in coming days, the Japan Meteorological Agency warned.

title.children: Japan earthquake survivors fear freezing rain, landslides as death toll rises to 64

image.altText: Ellen Evans looks into the distance with a clearly visible Christian pendant.

props.synopsis: Faith is not the only renewable resource the residents of the small Christian town of Poatina have, with the community supporting plans to help power a state.

title.children: 'The values that Jesus taught us': The town bought by a Christian organisation puts its faith in batteries

image.altText: An empty highway stretches into the distance with trees either side

props.synopsis: Police say a man climbed out of his car and verbally abused a 50-year-old woman while driving the Forrest Highway between Perth and the state's South West before he smashed her phone.

title.children: WA police searching for man after road rage incident involving woman 'going a little bit slow'

image.altText: Elaine sitting on the couch in her living room.

props.synopsis: Despite working since her 16th birthday, Elaine retired with just $45,000 in superannuation. Research shows superannuation is the biggest driver of wealth inequality in Australia – and women have much less of it than men.

title.children: 'I had so much promise in my life, and that's where I ended up': A lifetime of work leads to $45k in superannuation

image.altText: Naomi Osaka hitting a tennis ball

props.synopsis: Four-time grand slam champion Naomi Osaka had been making her tennis comeback this week after a nearly 16-month break from the game.

title.children: Osaka, Saville knocked out of Brisbane International but Sabalenka dominates

image.altText: Two police women talking to a boy in a puffer jacket.

props.synopsis: The 17-year-old was found alive but "cold and scared" in a tent in the Utah wilderness.

title.children: Chinese exchange student found in US woods after being 'cyber kidnapped'

image.altText: A woman wearing a grey jacket and blue glasses, speaks into a microphone.

props.synopsis: In the hearing, the outgoing president was unable to say that calls on campus for the genocide of Jews would violate the school's conduct policy.

title.children: Harvard president resigns amid plagiarism claims and criticism over testimony at congressional hearing

image.altText: A brown crab with white pincer tips and and a yellow sponge across its shell

props.synopsis: Broad-brimmed, legionnaire, sombrero — whatever your choice, even moderate UV days call for sun protection atop your noggin. But we're not the only hat-wearers in the animal kingdom.

title.children: Kelp and sponge make mighty fine hats — or at least whales, dolphins and crabs seem to think so
